items.summary: In backend/main.mo, replace all dynamic or placeholder resource URL generation logic with a fully hardcoded, structured conditional mapping. For each supported skill — Public Speaking, Python, Excel, UI Design, Photography, Writing — define a static array of exactly 2–3 resource objects (each with title, URL, and descriptor) for each of the 7 days. All URLs must be real, publicly accessible links such as official documentation pages (e.g., docs.python.org), YouTube search URLs (e.g., https://www.youtube.com/results?search_query=python+basics), freeCodeCamp articles, MDN Web Docs, Canva Design School, or Coursera free previews. No example.com, placeholder, or string-interpolated fake URLs are permitted. The conditional mapping must be purely static: skill name and skill level are used as keys to select the appropriate resource variant. Day themes must follow the existing progression: Day 1 = fundamentals/setup, Day 2 = core concept A, Day 3 = core concept B, Day 4 = practice, Day 5 = intermediate application, Day 6 = project/review, Day 7 = final assessment/wrap-up. Where multiple resource variants exist for the same day, skill level (Beginner / Intermediate / Advanced) must determine which variant is selected. For any skill not in the supported list (e.g., custom skill input), fall back to a set of generic but real learning resource links (e.g., YouTube search URL based on skill name, a freeCodeCamp or Khan Academy general learning link) rather than leaving the array empty.

Update backend/migration.mo so that on canister upgrade, any existing stored SprintPlans have their per-day resources arrays fully replaced using the new fixed resource mapping defined in REQ-25. Plans whose resources arrays contain example.com URLs, empty strings, or placeholder entries must be updated to the new real resource links. The migration must iterate over all stored plans, re-derive the correct skill/level/day resource mapping, and overwrite the resources field on each DayPlan accordingly.
